result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Lamar Tucker

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Tucker in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Tucker in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Foley J. Van Lieshout appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM028494  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/04/2022 sa
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Tucker in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Tucker in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Lamar Tucker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
